RTCPeerConnectionPeerIdentity.summary:
The peerIdentity read-only property of the interface returns a JavaScript {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves to an which contains a string identifying the remote peer.
Once this promise resolves successfully, the resulting identity is the target peer identity and cannot change for the duration of the connection.
RTCPeerConnectionPeerIdentity.value:
A JavaScript {{jsxref("Promise")}} which resolves to an that describes the remote peer's identity.If an error occurs while attempting to validate an incoming identity assertion (that is, the information describing a peer's identity), the promise is rejected.
If there isn't already a target peer identity, peerIdentity is set to a newly created promise and the process begins again, until the process succeeds or no further attempts to authenticate occur.The promise returned by cannot resolve until any target peer identity that's been set is validated.
If the identity hasn't been validated yet, the promise returned by setRemoteDescription() will be rejected.
If there's no target peer identity, setRemoteDescription() doesn't need to wait for validation to occur before it resolves.
